o the animals, the flowers and the wind; we could command the clouds to part and the waves to calm. We could coax out the secrets of the world, but we were not prophets, we could not see the future. We were nymphs, the handmaidens of nature, not the wielders of divine power.

In the world of gods and monsters, I was an anomaly. Neither fully a god, nor a simple nymph, but something in between. I was the daughter of Helios, the sun god, and Perse, a nymph of the ocean. From my father, I inherited the fierce radiance of the sun, the power to ignite and burn. From my mother, I inherited the fluid grace of the sea, the ability to heal and soothe.
